intro: Cardamine lihengiana, commonly known as the Liheng buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. Native to China, it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant has a short flowering period, usually in spring, and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
